comments.body:
we should really consider writing a better tool for this, piling on lots of grep over the k8s codebase has got to get slow...

how useful is enforcing this in CI, actually ...? ðŸ¤·â€â™‚

This greps e2e test files only and even after applying this PR, this part (verify-test-code.sh) of pull-kubernetes-verify job takes 3 seconds as https://prow.k8s.io/view/gcs/kubernetes-jenkins/pr-logs/pull/89215/pull-kubernetes-verify/1240183762671636481
That doesn't seem to take much time and it would be fine to try finding a better way when it would take more time to run, I feel.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +50,54 @@for file in "${all_e2e_files[@]}"
do
    if grep -E "Expect\(.*\)\.(NotTo|ToNot)\((gomega\.Equal|Equal)" "${file}" > /dev/null
    then
        errors_expect_no_equal+=( "${file}" )

comments.body: NOTE: see previous discussions in this repo: we don't use mapfile because it doesn't exist on macOS. there are examples of alternatives eleswhere in hack/ such as the verify-shellcheck script (read loop)
this particular change looks fine, but the original implementation probably should not have introduced mapfile usage
@BenTheElder I see, thanks for your comment. I will follow the mapfile issue with another PR with some digging.

There is a tool inside `hack/lib/util.sh` called `kube::util::read-array` that works the same way as `mapfile -t`, and works in bash3 :smile: @oomichi @BenTheElder But yeah, that can be fixed in another PR.

https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/b3a73f761f5b67f783d40a8b89dce47c5a015909/hack/lib/util.sh#L715
@oomichi @odinuge thanks! that's exactly the thing to do, let's do that in another PR. feel free to ping me on that one for approval :sweat_smile:

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +22,26 @@
# NOTE: This checks e2e test code without the e2e framework which contains Expect().To(HaveOccurred())
mapfile -t all_e2e_files < <(find test/e2e{,_node,_kubeadm} -name '*.go' | grep -v 'test/e2e/framework/')
errors_expect_no_error=()
for file in "${all_e2e_files[@]}"

comments.body:
verify-test-code.sh adds to detect `Expect(err).ToNot(HaveOccurred())`.
But, it says about only `NotTo` as the below.
```
The above files need to use framework.ExpectNoError(err) instead of
Expect(err).NotTo(HaveOccurred()) or gomega.Expect(err).NotTo(gomega.HaveOccurred())
```
Why don't you add `ToNot` to error comment? Is it redundant?

That is a nice point.
As we see, `ToNot` is not major and I feel it could be enough to contain `NotTo` only for easy explanation.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +26,30 @@for file in "${all_e2e_files[@]}"
do
    if grep -E "Expect\(.*\)\.(NotTo|ToNot)\(.*HaveOccurred\(\)" "${file}" > /dev/null
    then
        errors_expect_no_error+=( "${file}" )
